trial_identification.studytitle: Safety and Immunogenecity Study of an E.Coli Expressed Particulate Recombinant Hepatitis E Vaccine
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Safety and Immunogenecity Study of an E.Coli Expressed Particulate Recombinant Hepatitis E Vaccine

interventions.interventions:
Intervention: hepatitis E (HE) vaccine The subjects were randomized and assigned to groups to administrate intramuscular injection either two 20µg HE vaccine doses (0 month, 6th month), three 10µg, 20µg, 30µg or 40 µg of HE vaccine 20 µg dose (0 month, 1st month, 6th month) respectively.
Participants received intervention treatment or control treatment will be followed-up for 1 month after the last vaccination.
interventions.comparator: Control treatment: commercial hepatitis B vaccine The subjects were randomly assigned to group to administrate intramuscular injection three 5µg commercial hepatitis B vaccine doses (0 month, 1st month, 6th month).

primaryOutcome.outcome: Seroconversion rate of immunoglobulin gamman (IgG) antibody against hepatitis E virus (HEV).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At one month after the last intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Level of IgG antibody against hepatitis E virus
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 0, 1 and 7 months after the last intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Novel infection rate of hepatitis E virus
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At 0, 1, and 7 months after the last intervention

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Healthy; willing to comply the protocol; have not been adminastrated with any other preventive products such as vaccine or immunoglobulin.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Any anaphylaxis history to vaccination or medicine; any neurotic or mental disease history or family history; impediment of cruor; any confirmed or possible immuno-deficiency; any active infection; serious liver, kidney, or cardio-vascular diseases; malignant tumor, serious asthma; spleen removal; hypertension; pregnant or lactatation period woman; fever; antibody against hepatitis E virus (anti-HEV) positive; alanine transaminase abnormal; blood urea nitrogen abnormal; glucose abnormal; Hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBsAg) positive.

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomization table created by computer software
trial_design.designfeatures: The people receiving the vaccines, the people administering the vaccination and the people assessing the outcomes were blinded.

fundingsource.fundingname: Ministry of Science and Technology of China

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: National Institute of Diagnostics and Vaccine Development in infectious disease, Xiamen University

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of the protocol is to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of an E.coli expressed particulate recombinant hepatitis E vaccine. The study hypothesis is that the vaccine induce significant seroconversion of IgG anti-HEV in healthy subjects, and the vaccine is tolerable for healthy adults.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The institutional review boards of Guangxi Province-Liucheng county
The institutional review boards of Guangxi Province-Mengshan county
